responses: General visiting hours are 10 a.m.-8 p.m. daily, though some units have stricter rules.
Most wards welcome visitors from midmorning to early evening (10 a.m.-8 p.m.). Please check at the nurse's station for unitspecific times.
The ICU allows two visitors at a time during limited blocks-please ask ICU staff for exact slots.
Children under 12 may have restrictions; speak with the charge nurse before bringing young visitors.
During flu/COVID season, hours or visitor numbers may change. We recommend confirming with the ward before you arrive.
If you need to visit outside standard times for special reasons, please discuss with the patient's nurse.
On holidays and weekends, hours usually remain 10 a.m.-8 p.m., but it's best to call ahead to verify.
Standard visiting runs 10 a.m.-8 p.m., but please confirm with the specific unit before arrival.
ICU typically limits visits to 15minute blocks-check at the ICU desk for the exact times today.
Pediatric wards allow one parent or guardian 24/7; other visitors must follow posted hours.
During influenza season, visiting may be restricted; call ahead or view updates on our website.
Quiet hours start at 8 p.m.; visitors after that time need prior approval from the charge nurse.
Holiday schedules often match regular hours, though highacuity units may shorten visiting periods.
Only two visitors at a time are allowed in most rooms-please rotate quietly in shared spaces.
Overnight stays require an overnight visitor pass-ask Security in the lobby for assistance.
Children under 12 must be supervised at all times and may be limited in certain units.
If you have special circumstances, speak with the patient's nurse to arrange an exception.
Uptodate visiting information is also available via our main phone line, option 2.

responses: Visitor parking is located in Garage A next to the main entrance; follow the blue 'Parking' signs.
Standard parking is $3 per hour, capped at $12 per day. Pay at the kiosks before exiting.
We validate tickets for outpatient procedures-present your ticket at the clinic desk for a discount.
Accessible (disabled) parking spots are available on every level near the elevators in Garage A.
Valet service is offered weekdays 7 a.m.-6 p.m. at the main entrance for a flat $5 fee plus parking.
Overnight parking is allowed; please notify Security if you plan to leave your car past midnight.
Electric vehicle charging stations are located on Level 2 of the garage-standard parking fees apply.
Garage A and Garage B both serve visitors; Garage A is closest to the main lobby entrance.
Motorcycle spaces are located near the exit ramp on the ground level of Garage A.
For maternity or shortstay visits, Lot C provides the shortest walk to that entrance.
Parking kiosks are situated by every elevator bank-pay before returning to your car.
EV charging is complimentary for the first two hours; standard fees apply thereafter.
Valet can be accessed directly in front of the hospital weekday mornings until 6 p.m.
Street parking has a twohour limit and is heavily patrolled; we recommend the garage for longer stays.
Discounted weekly passes are available for longterm visitors at the parking office in Garage A.
Present outpatient procedure paperwork at the lobby desk for partial validation of parking fees.

responses: All main entrances have ramps and automatic doors for wheelchair access.
Free wheelchairs are available at the information desk in the main lobby-please present a photo ID.
Elevators are located next to each main entrance and are sized for wheelchairs and mobility scooters.
Accessible restrooms are on every floor near the central elevators; look for the wheelchair symbol.
If you need assistance, our transport team can escort you-just ask at the front desk or press the help button on any courtesy phone.
Garage A includes accessible parking spots near the elevators. From there, a covered ramp leads to the main lobby.
When you're finished, you can return the wheelchair to any marked dropoff zone or the information desk.
All entrances have curbcuts and ramps that comply with ADA standards.
Courtesy wheelchairs are stationed by the Information Desk; show photo ID to borrow one.
Our patient transport team can assist with wheelchair escorts-ask at any courtesy phone for help.
Elevators with extrawide doors are located beside the central atrium and run to all floors.
Accessible restrooms are marked with the wheelchair symbol and available near every elevator core.
You may reserve a wheelchair ahead of time by calling extension 4411.
Mobility scooters may be borrowed through Patient Services in the lobby.
A tactile guidance path for lowvision visitors begins at the main entrance and leads to key departments.
Staff wearing blue 'Transport' badges can guide you along an accessible route to Radiology or Cafeteria.
Garage A has vanaccessible parking spots adjacent to the elevator lobby.
When finished, return wheelchairs to any marked dropoff point or leave them with Security at the door.

responses: Our Security Office manages lost and found and is located on the ground floor near the east entrance.
You can report or claim items weekdays 8 a.m.-6 p.m. at the Security window or by calling extension 5555.
To check on a lost item, please provide a detailed description; Security logs all items for 30 days.
If you found something, turn it in at any nursing station or directly at the Security Office.
After regular hours, Security dispatch can still assist-use the courtesy phone in the lobby.
Small valuable items like jewelry or phones are stored securely in the vault until claimed.
Unclaimed items are donated after 30 days, so please reach out as soon as possible.
Security keeps a detailed log-please bring ID and a description when claiming items.
Lost items can also be reported online via the hospital website; you'll receive a ticket number for followup.
Smaller valuables are stored in a secure vault; larger items are tagged and kept in a locked storeroom.
If your item was lost in the cafeteria, check with Cafeteria Management first before visiting Security.
Photo ID is required to pick up any valuable item such as a phone, wallet, or jewelry.
Items turned in after hours are recorded the next business day; Security will call you if contact info is attached.
Found items can be left at any nursing station; they are delivered to Security twice daily.
Unclaimed medical equipment is held for 7 days before being processed under separate procedures-contact Biomedical Services.
Call extension 5555 and select option 3 for a status update on your lost property report.
Parents looking for lost toys or clothing may also check with the Pediatric Playroom before contacting Security.
Security donates unclaimed clothing to charity after 30 days; electronics are kept 45 days.

responses: Maternity (Labor & Delivery) is on the third floor, south wing-take the pink elevators to Level 3.
Head to Level 3 and follow the signs marked 'Maternity / L&D'. Staff at the desk can assist you.
The birthing center is located on 3 South; use the central elevators and turn left.
For deliveries, check in at the Maternity desk on the third floor beside the waiting lounge.
Visitors should go to the thirdfloor maternity reception; please ring the bell for entry.
If you're in active labor, you may also enter through the private L&D entrance at the rear of the hospital.
Need extra assistance? Security or volunteers can escort you to Maternity on Level 3.

Labor & Delivery checkin is on 3 South across from the waiting lounge.
Signs marked 'Maternity' in pink will guide you from the main lobby to Level 3.

Birthing suites are on 3 South-reception staff can confirm room assignments.
From Garage C, follow the stork footprints on the floor to the maternity wing.
Volunteers in pink jackets can escort you to the birthing center on request.
Obstetrics triage is adjacent to the main Maternity desk on Level 3.
Expecting mothers may also use the direct-access lift from the valet dropoff to Level 3.
Postpartum rooms share the same corridor; follow signage for Mother & Baby.
If elevators are busy, stairs opposite the cafe also lead to Level 3 Maternity.

responses: Oncology is on Level 2, west wing. Take the purple elevators and follow the 'Cancer Center' signs.
You'll find the oncology clinic on the 2nd floor; turn left after exiting the main elevators.
The Cancer Center is located on 2 West, beside Radiation Therapy. Volunteers can guide you if needed.
For chemotherapy, check in at the Oncology Day Unit on Level 2 across from the infusion bays.
If you're visiting a patient, the inpatient oncology ward is also on Level 2-ring the bell for entry.
Need extra help? Staff at the information desk can escort you to the oncology department.
Parking Garage B connects directly to Level 2 Oncology via the skybridge if that's more convenient.
Turn right from the main lobby, take Elevator B to floor 2; Oncology reception is straight ahead.
Chemo infusion bays are across from Oncology registration on 2 West.
Radiation Therapy shares the same corridor-follow purple floor lines to reach both areas.
If you parked in Garage B, the skybridge brings you directly to Level 2 Oncology.
HematologyOncology offices are beside the Cancer Center waiting area on Level 2.
For medication pickup after chemo, the Oncology pharmacy window is just past the infusion center.
Volunteers in lavender vests can escort you to Oncology if you'd like guidance.
Visiting the inpatient Cancer Ward? Ring the bell outside 2 West and staff will buzz you in.
Oncology reception offers wheelchairs-ask at the desk if needed.
If elevators are busy, the west stairwell also leads to Level 2 Oncology.
Parking validation for cancer patients is available at the Oncology front desk.

responses: The NICU is located on Level 3, south wing-take the pink elevators and follow the 'NICU' signs.
To visit the neonatal intensive care unit, go to the 3rd floor and ring the security bell at the NICU entrance.
From maternity, head left down the corridor; the NICU is just past the newborn viewing area.
For quickest access, use Elevator C to Level 3 and look for the teal 'Neonatal ICU' signage.
All visitors must scrub in at the NICU handwashing station before entering.
If you need help, volunteers in blue vests can escort you to the NICU reception desk.
After 8 p.m., access to the NICU is via the security entrance on Level 3-please have ID ready.
From Labor & Delivery, follow the teal NICU signs and use the secure double doors.
Parents may enter NICU 24/7 with ID-ring the bell at Level 3 South entrance.
Grandparents and visitors must stop at the NICU reception to receive a badge.
Handwashing sinks are located immediately outside the NICU doors-please scrub for 2 minutes.
For latenight access, use Elevator C and press the intercom beside the NICU entrance.
Special Care Nursery rooms are in the same corridor as NICU, just past the family lounge.
Volunteers in pink jackets can guide firsttime visitors to the neonatal unit.
Incubator rooms are labeled alphabetically; staff at reception will direct you after checkin.
Pump rooms for nursing mothers are opposite the NICU waiting area.
Follow storkfootprint decals on the floor from Maternity to reach the NICU quickly.
Lockers for personal items are available outside the NICU-ask reception for a key.

responses: Cardiology is on the 5th floor, north tower. Take the red elevators to Level 5 and follow the 'Heart Center' signs.
For outpatient cardiology visits, check in at the Cardiac Clinic desk on 5 North.
The cath lab and electrophysiology suites are located on Level 5; staff will guide you after registration.
If you're visiting the coronary care unit, it's adjacent to the main cardiology ward on 5 North-use the intercom for entry.
Cardiology imaging (echo, stress test) is across from the clinic waiting area on Level 5.
Volunteers in red jackets can escort you from the lobby to the cardiology department if needed.
Patients with mobility challenges may use the north tower elevators, which stop directly opposite Cardiology reception.
After exiting the red elevators on Level 5, Cardiology reception will be on your right.
Heart Center signage in red directs you from the lobby to the north tower elevators.
Patients for stress tests should check in at the Cardiology Imaging desk opposite the waiting room.
The electrophysiology lab is two doors past the cath lab on 5 North.
Visitors to CCU must use the intercom and sanitize hands before entry.
Cardiac rehab classrooms are next to the Heart Failure Clinic on Level 5.
If you parked in Garage A, follow red banners to the Heart Center elevators.
Wheelchairaccessible restrooms are located beside Cardiology reception.
Pharmacy pickup for cardiac meds is on the same floor, next to the elevators.
Volunteer escorts in red vests are available in the lobby for Cardiology patients.
Please arrive 15 minutes early for outpatient heart appointments; registration kiosks are at Cardiology's entrance.

Quiet waiting areas for neuro patients are located at the end of the 4 East corridor.
Secure entry to the Neuro ICU requires pressing the intercom and waiting for staff to unlock the doors.

If you're bringing a specimen, please label it and proceed to the pathology intake door beside Lab Reception.

If Radiology sent you, the lab is across the corridor-look for bright yellow signage.
After 6 p.m., ring the afterhours bell next to the main lab door for assistance.
Parking validation for lab visits is at the Information Desk-show your lab receipt.
Need help? Volunteers in green vests can escort you from the lobby straight to Lab Services.

responses: Ambulatory (day) Surgery is on Level 2, west wing-take the purple elevators to floor 2 and follow the 'Outpatient Surgery' signs.
Please check in at the Ambulatory Surgery reception desk on 2 West, opposite PreOp.
For sameday procedures, use Elevator B to Level 2; the unit entrance will be directly ahead.
Families can wait in the Day Surgery lounge on Level 2 next to the recovery bays.
If you parked in Garage A, cross the skybridge to Level 2; Ambulatory Surgery is the first suite on the right.
Need assistance? Volunteers wearing purple badges can escort you to the Ambulatory Surgery Center.
After your procedure, discharge instructions are given at the recovery desk on 2 West.
Preop forms are reviewed at Desk A just inside the Ambulatory Surgery doors.
Recovery bays are located behind the checkin desk on Level 2 west.
Family updates are posted on the monitor in the Day Surgery lounge.
Locker storage for personal items is available near PreOp.
Patients should arrive 90 minutes early-registration kiosks are outside the unit entrance.
Wheelchair transport can meet you at the skybridge if requested.
Use purple floor stripes from the lobby to reach the surgery center.
Discharge pickup is curbside at the Level 2 roundabout-follow signs for Day Surgery Exit.
If you need directions, volunteers with purple lanyards can guide you.
Anesthesia clinic is adjacent to Ambulatory Surgery reception for lastminute questions.
Parking validation for day surgery is handled at the reception desk.

responses: Physical Therapy is on Level 1, east wing-follow the green 'Rehabilitation' signs from the main lobby.
For outpatient PT, take the blue elevators to Floor 1; the clinic entrance is beside the rehab gym.
Please check in at the Physical Therapy reception desk on 1 East.
The therapy gym is located directly behind the PT reception; staff will guide you after you sign in.
If you need equipment fitting, the assistivedevice room is within the PT suite on Level 1.
Volunteer escorts in green vests can accompany you to Physical Therapy if needed.
Patients with mobility challenges may use the accessible entrance on Level 1 via the east ramp.
Follow green footprints on the floor to reach the Rehab gym on Level 1 east.
Hydrotherapy pool is two doors past the PT reception desk.
Sports rehab services are in the same suite-ask the clerk for directions.
OT and PT share a waiting area; checkin tablets are on the right.
Earlymorning patients may enter via the east ramp before main doors open.
Adaptive equipment shop is next to the therapy gym for walker fittings.
Volunteer escorts in green shirts can walk you to the PT clinic.
Neurorehab PT rooms are labeled N1N5 down the rear hallway.
Family can observe therapy through the viewing window beside Room 3.
Please arrive 10 minutes early to complete exercise screening forms.
If elevators are busy, stairs opposite Radiology also reach Level 1 PT.

responses: Yes, free WiFi is available throughout the hospital. Choose the network 'TRHGuest' and accept the terms to connect-no password required.
Select the 'TRHGuest' network on your device, open a browser, and tap 'Accept' on the welcome page.
If your connection drops, try toggling WiFi off and on or moving closer to a hallway access point.
Guest WiFi is open and unencrypted; avoid accessing sensitive accounts unless you use a VPN.
WiFi speeds support basic browsing and video calls but may slow during peak times.
Need help? Call the IT Service Desk at extension 4444, or ask a volunteer to assist.
Staff have a separate secure network. Visitors should use 'TRHGuest' for internet access.
Connect to 'TRHGuest', open a browser, and tap 'Accept'-no password needed.
If the splash page doesn't appear, visit any nonsecure site to trigger it.
Signal is strongest near hallways; interior rooms may see slower speeds.
Bandwidth supports video calls but may throttle large downloads.
Need help? Call IT at ext 4444 or visit the Tech Help Desk in the lobby.
Guest WiFi is not encrypted; consider using a VPN for sensitive tasks.
You can connect up to three devices per patient room.
Streaming services function, but quality may drop during peak hours.
Wired ports are available in select rooms-ask your nurse for a cable.
Staff network uses WPA2; guests must stay on 'TRHGuest'.
There is no data cap, but idle devices may be disconnected after 4 hours.

responses: Today's lunch specials include grilled chicken with quinoa, vegetable lasagna (vegetarian), and tomato basil soup.
The cafeteria rotates menus daily; you can view the full list on the digital board at the entrance or via the QR code posted on each table.
Vegetarian, vegan, glutenfree, and halal options are available every day-just ask the server for details.
Breakfast is served 6 a.m.-10 a.m.; the grill reopens for lunch at 11 a.m. and closes at 2 p.m.
Coffee, tea, and grabandgo snacks are available all day near the cashier.
Friday features baked fish with lemon herb rice, plus a chef's salad bar and minestrone soup.
If you have dietary restrictions, let the cafeteria staff know-they can suggest suitable items.
Weekly menus are posted online-scan the QR code by the cafeteria doors.
Today's vegan entree is roasted vegetable quinoa bowl.

Halal chicken shawarma is featured at lunch until 2 p.m.
Soup rotation lists tomato basil, chicken noodle, and lentil today.

Price for salad bar is $7.99 per pound; small bowl discount available.
Lowsodium options are labeled with a green heart icon on the board.
Kids' meals come with fruit cup and milk for $5.
Nutritional information is printed above each hot entree.
Menu changes slightly on weekends-check the board for updated specials.

responses: Our COVID protocols currently allow two visitors per patient per day; all visitors must selfscreen for symptoms on arrival.
No proof of vaccination is required, but we ask that anyone feeling unwell postpone their visit.
Preprocedure COVID testing is no longer routine, except for highrisk surgeries; your care team will let you know if one is needed.
Masks remain optional for most areas; however, they are required in units housing immunocompromised patients-signage will indicate where.
Rapid antigen tests are available at the entrance desk for a small fee if you need one before visiting.
If you have COVIDlike symptoms, please reschedule nonurgent visits and contact your primary provider or call our COVID hotline at 5550123.
Policies may change quickly; for the most uptodate information, check the hospital website or ask the frontdesk staff on arrival.
COVIDpositive patients are treated in a separate isolation area. Visitation is restricted and must be arranged with the unit in advance.
Visitor limits are currently two per patient per day; masks are optional except in highrisk zones.
PCR tests are only needed for highrisk surgeries; your provider will inform you if required.
Proof of vaccination is not required, but please stay home if experiencing symptoms.
Rapid tests are available in the lobby for a nominal fee; results in 15 minutes.
COVIDpositive patients are in isolation units with restricted visitation-coordinate with the nurse manager.
Selfscreen kiosks at entrances ask about fever, cough, and exposure-please answer honestly.
Social distancing markers have been removed, but we encourage spacing in crowded areas.
Children under 12 may visit if symptomfree and supervised.
Our COVID hotline (5550123) operates 8 a.m.-6 p.m. daily for protocol questions.
Policies can change-check our website on the day of your visit.
Rooms are disinfected between patients and hightouch areas cleaned every 4 hours.
Support persons do not count toward the twovisitor limit for maternity or NICU.

responses: Masks are optional in most public areas but are required in designated highrisk units and when instructed by staff.
If you do not have a mask, surgical masks are available for free at every entrance and nursing station.
Visitors may remove masks while actively eating or drinking but must replace them afterward.
Children over age two are encouraged to wear masks; those under two should not be masked for safety reasons.
Some specialty units-like Oncology and NICU-still require everyone to wear a surgical or KN95 mask at all times.
Staff follow universal masking when providing direct patient care, even if visitors are optional.
Face shields can supplement but not replace an approved mask.
If unsure, please follow signage and any directions given by care staff regarding mask use.
Masks remain strongly recommended for crowded indoor areas.
Visitors entering Oncology, NICU, or Bone Marrow Transplant units must wear hospitalprovided masks.
Surgical masks are free at entrances; N95s are allowed but not required.
Vaccinated individuals may unmask in public corridors unless signage states otherwise.
Masks can be removed briefly for ID checks or eating, but please replace promptly.
Face shields alone are insufficient; pair them with a mask.
Children under two should not wear masks for safety reasons.
Knotted ear loops improve fit of standard surgical masks.
Failure to comply in required areas may result in visitor removal.
Mask policy is the same seven days a week.
Staff always mask during direct patient contact.
Double masking is optional; one wellfitting mask is acceptable.

responses: General visiting hours are 10 a.m.–8 p.m. daily, though some units have stricter rules.
Most wards welcome visitors from mid‑morning to early evening (10 a.m.–8 p.m.). Please check at the nurse’s station for unit‑specific times.
The ICU allows two visitors at a time during limited blocks—please ask ICU staff for exact slots.
Children under 12 may have restrictions; speak with the charge nurse before bringing young visitors.
During flu/COVID season, hours or visitor numbers may change. We recommend confirming with the ward before you arrive.
If you need to visit outside standard times for special reasons, please discuss with the patient’s nurse.
On holidays and weekends, hours usually remain 10 a.m.–8 p.m., but it’s best to call ahead to verify.
Standard visiting runs 10 a.m.–8 p.m., but please confirm with the specific unit before arrival.
ICU typically limits visits to 15‑minute blocks—check at the ICU desk for the exact times today.
Pediatric wards allow one parent or guardian 24/7; other visitors must follow posted hours.
During influenza season, visiting may be restricted; call ahead or view updates on our website.
Quiet hours start at 8 p.m.; visitors after that time need prior approval from the charge nurse.
Holiday schedules often match regular hours, though high‑acuity units may shorten visiting periods.
Only two visitors at a time are allowed in most rooms—please rotate quietly in shared spaces.
Overnight stays require an overnight visitor pass—ask Security in the lobby for assistance.
Children under 12 must be supervised at all times and may be limited in certain units.
If you have special circumstances, speak with the patient’s nurse to arrange an exception.
Up‑to‑date visiting information is also available via our main phone line, option 2.

responses: Visitor parking is located in Garage A next to the main entrance; follow the blue ‘Parking’ signs.
Standard parking is $3 per hour, capped at $12 per day. Pay at the kiosks before exiting.
We validate tickets for outpatient procedures—present your ticket at the clinic desk for a discount.
Accessible (disabled) parking spots are available on every level near the elevators in Garage A.
Valet service is offered weekdays 7 a.m.–6 p.m. at the main entrance for a flat $5 fee plus parking.
Overnight parking is allowed; please notify Security if you plan to leave your car past midnight.
Electric vehicle charging stations are located on Level 2 of the garage—standard parking fees apply.
Garage A and Garage B both serve visitors; Garage A is closest to the main lobby entrance.
Daily maximum parking fee is $12; payment kiosks accept cash or card on each level.
If you leave and return the same day, present your ticket at Security for a same‑day re‑entry stamp.
Motorcycle spaces are located near the exit ramp on the ground level of Garage A.
For maternity or short‑stay visits, Lot C provides the shortest walk to that entrance.
Parking kiosks are situated by every elevator bank—pay before returning to your car.
EV charging is complimentary for the first two hours; standard fees apply thereafter.
Valet can be accessed directly in front of the hospital weekday mornings until 6 p.m.
Street parking has a two‑hour limit and is heavily patrolled; we recommend the garage for longer stays.
Discounted weekly passes are available for long‑term visitors at the parking office in Garage A.
Present outpatient procedure paperwork at the lobby desk for partial validation of parking fees.

responses: All main entrances have ramps and automatic doors for wheelchair access.
Free wheelchairs are available at the information desk in the main lobby—please present a photo ID.
Elevators are located next to each main entrance and are sized for wheelchairs and mobility scooters.
Accessible restrooms are on every floor near the central elevators; look for the wheelchair symbol.
If you need assistance, our transport team can escort you—just ask at the front desk or press the help button on any courtesy phone.
Garage A includes accessible parking spots near the elevators. From there, a covered ramp leads to the main lobby.
When you’re finished, you can return the wheelchair to any marked drop‑off zone or the information desk.
All entrances have curb‑cuts and ramps that comply with ADA standards.
Courtesy wheelchairs are stationed by the Information Desk; show photo ID to borrow one.
Our patient transport team can assist with wheelchair escorts—ask at any courtesy phone for help.
Elevators with extra‑wide doors are located beside the central atrium and run to all floors.
Accessible restrooms are marked with the wheelchair symbol and available near every elevator core.
You may reserve a wheelchair ahead of time by calling extension 4411.
Mobility scooters may be borrowed through Patient Services in the lobby.
A tactile guidance path for low‑vision visitors begins at the main entrance and leads to key departments.
Staff wearing blue ‘Transport’ badges can guide you along an accessible route to Radiology or Cafeteria.
Garage A has van‑accessible parking spots adjacent to the elevator lobby.
When finished, return wheelchairs to any marked drop‑off point or leave them with Security at the door.

responses: Our Security Office manages lost and found and is located on the ground floor near the east entrance.
You can report or claim items weekdays 8 a.m.–6 p.m. at the Security window or by calling extension 5555.
To check on a lost item, please provide a detailed description; Security logs all items for 30 days.
If you found something, turn it in at any nursing station or directly at the Security Office.
After regular hours, Security dispatch can still assist—use the courtesy phone in the lobby.
Small valuable items like jewelry or phones are stored securely in the vault until claimed.
Unclaimed items are donated after 30 days, so please reach out as soon as possible.
Security keeps a detailed log—please bring ID and a description when claiming items.
Lost items can also be reported online via the hospital website; you’ll receive a ticket number for follow‑up.
Smaller valuables are stored in a secure vault; larger items are tagged and kept in a locked storeroom.
If your item was lost in the cafeteria, check with Cafeteria Management first before visiting Security.
Photo ID is required to pick up any valuable item such as a phone, wallet, or jewelry.
Items turned in after hours are recorded the next business day; Security will call you if contact info is attached.
Found items can be left at any nursing station; they are delivered to Security twice daily.
Unclaimed medical equipment is held for 7 days before being processed under separate procedures—contact Biomedical Services.
Call extension 5555 and select option 3 for a status update on your lost property report.
Parents looking for lost toys or clothing may also check with the Pediatric Playroom before contacting Security.
Security donates unclaimed clothing to charity after 30 days; electronics are kept 45 days.

responses: General visiting hours are 10 a.m.–8 p.m. daily, though some units have stricter rules.
Most wards welcome visitors from mid‑morning to early evening (10 a.m.–8 p.m.). Please check at the nurse’s station for unit‑specific times.
The ICU allows two visitors at a time during limited blocks—please ask ICU staff for exact slots.
Children under 12 may have restrictions; speak with the charge nurse before bringing young visitors.
During flu/COVID season, hours or visitor numbers may change. We recommend confirming with the ward before you arrive.
If you need to visit outside standard times for special reasons, please discuss with the patient’s nurse.
On holidays and weekends, hours usually remain 10 a.m.–8 p.m., but it’s best to call ahead to verify.

Standard parking is $3 per hour, capped at $12 per day. Pay at the kiosks before exiting.
We validate tickets for outpatient procedures—present your ticket at the clinic desk for a discount.
Accessible (disabled) parking spots are available on every level near the elevators in Garage A.

Overnight parking is allowed; please notify Security if you plan to leave your car past midnight.
Electric vehicle charging stations are located on Level 2 of the garage—standard parking fees apply.
